dt: {bc}profuse or {d_link|exuberant|exuberant} in words, expression, or style
{bc}present in large quantity {bc}taking place on a large scale

pt: {sc}plentiful{/sc} {sc}ample{/sc} {sc}abundant{/sc} {sc}copious{/sc} mean more than sufficient without being excessive. {sc}plentiful{/sc} implies a great or rich supply.
{sc}ample{/sc} implies a generous sufficiency to satisfy a particular requirement.
{sc}abundant{/sc} suggests an even greater or richer supply than does {sc}plentiful{/sc}.
{sc}copious{/sc} stresses largeness of supply rather than fullness or richness.

quotes.t: The Constants—ignorant, vulgar, and brash—had {qword}copious{/qword} quantities of dumb luck.
… travelers grew accustomed to having {qword}copious{/qword} helpings of meat when they visited Quimper's inn.
These pockets of melted rock are rich in silica and release {qword}copious{/qword} amounts of volatile gases that are held under high pressures.
It was no surprise that spin was more {qword}copious{/qword} than ever during the election campaign.

et: Middle English, from Latin {it}copiosus{/it}, from {it}copia{/it} abundance, from {it}co-{/it} + {it}ops{/it} wealth {ma}{mat|opulent|}{/ma}
shortdef: full of thought, information, or matter
